# Binary encoding
This repository contains a Python script to generate two functions: ```bin_to_txt()``` and ```txt_to_bin()```, which convert binary to text and text to binary, respectively.

## Binary-to-text
To convert binary to text, use ```bin_to_txt()``` and enter a binary string. This does not have to be seperated in bytes and may also contain spaces outside of byte deliminations.

For example:
```
bin_to_txt("")
```
will return
```
Zeeland (historical English exonym Zealand) is the westernmost and least populous province of the Netherlands. (Source: Wikipedia).
```

## Text-to-binary
To then have the binary returned, you can use ```txt_to_bin()```. This has an extra argument 'bytes' which indicates whether the returned binary code should be seperated in bytes and defaults to true.

To turn the previous result back to binary, we use:
```
txt_to_bin("Zeeland (historical English exonym Zealand) is the westernmost and least populous province of the Netherlands. (Source: Wikipedia).")
```
to get
```
1011010 01100101 01100101 01101100 01100001 01101110 01100100 00100000 00101000 01101000 01101001 01110011 01110100 01101111 01110010 01101001 01100011 01100001 01101100 00100000 01000101 01101110 01100111 01101100 01101001 01110011 01101000 00100000 01100101 01111000 01101111 01101110 01111001 01101101 00100000 01011010 01100101 01100001 01101100 01100001 01101110 01100100 00101001 00100000 01101001 01110011 00100000 01110100 01101000 01100101 00100000 01110111 01100101 01110011 01110100 01100101 01110010 01101110 01101101 01101111 01110011 01110100 00100000 01100001 01101110 01100100 00100000 01101100 01100101 01100001 01110011 01110100 00100000 01110000 01101111 01110000 01110101 01101100 01101111 01110101 01110011 00100000 01110000 01110010 01101111 01110110 01101001 01101110 01100011 01100101 00100000 01101111 01100110 00100000 01110100 01101000 01100101 00100000 01001110 01100101 01110100 01101000 01100101 01110010 01101100 01100001 01101110 01100100 01110011 00101110 00100000 00101000 01010011 01101111 01110101 01110010 01100011 01100101 00111010 00100000 01010111 01101001 01101011 01101001 01110000 01100101 01100100 01101001 01100001 00101001 00101110
```
or we use 
```
txt_to_bin("Zeeland (historical English exonym Zealand) is the westernmost and least populous province of the Netherlands. (Source: Wikipedia).", bytes = False)
```
to get
```

```

## Remaining plans
Right now the functions only support a non-accented Loman alphabet, although I aim to expand the ASCII table for special characters. In addition, it would be nice to create an interface to use the code.
